snippet: To promote the documentary “Girl Rising,” the makers will rely on techniques often used by more traditional advertisers, including personalized ads for employees of companies viewing it online.
abstract: Tanzina Vega Advertising column describes innovative campaign for documentary Girl Rising that will target employees at 57 companies in hopes that they will support efforts to educate girls in developing countries.

snippet: T-Mobile has said it will start selling Apple products in 2013, but will stop underwriting the cost of phones with its contracts. Is getting a $650 iPhone from T-Mobile a good deal? It can be - especially for heavy data users.

snippet: The Center for Digital Democracy, an advocacy group in Washington, says SpongeBob Diner Dash collected personal information about children without obtaining parental consent. The Nickelodeon network, which carries the SpongeBob SquarePants show, t...
abstract: The Center for Digital Democracy, an advocacy group in Washington, says SpongeBob Diner Dash collected personal information about children without obtaining parental consent. The Nickelodeon network, which carries the SpongeBob SquarePants show, temporarily removed the app from the Apple App Store on Monday.

headline.main: SpongeBob Game Removed From App Store After Complaints

snippet: With more parents putting mobile devices into preschoolers’ hands and laps, television networks like Nick Jr. and PBS are turning their focus to educational apps.
abstract: Preschool cable network Nick Jr and PBS are developing educational and promotional apps, attempting to tap new market as more parents put mobile devices into their children's hands.
